Lines of Business

Lesson
objectives ¢ Describe the implementation of Lines of

Business in ClaimCenter 10
« Add and remove items from the various levels
of the Line of Business model

About the ClaimCenter line of business
(LOB) model

What are lines of business?
| iF Gi
¢ Insurers organize policies, coverages, Property
and covered losses in a hierarchy

* This hierarchy impacts: Eq J pomeowners
Line

* How reporting is done
* Which coverages are displayed for a claim
associated with a given policy type [rosy rier

. . Policy
« Which user interface elements capture
information for a given exposure

¢ This hierarchy is known as the “line of Med Pay
business” (LOB) model
Homeowners
* In ClaimCenter, it has six levels Med. Pay. / Medical
. Payments
¢ Implemented as a special set of
Medical

typelists

Payments

| Loss type Gi

Highest-level category of loss.
* Ties together policies, coverages, and claims that deal with similar losses

¢ Useful for dynamic generation of User Interface and for reporting

A business categorization below Loss Type.

¢ More granular than loss type for reporting purposes
* Not commonly used as a determinant for claims handling

i Coverage subtype maps coverage type to exposure type

¢ ClaimCenter uses an additional layer
of the Lines of Business to represent
the M:M mapping from Coverage Type
to Exposure Type

* This layer is called Coverage Subtype

* Each Coverage Subtype is a single
mapping between one coverage type and
one exposure type.

¢ Enables situations where the same
coverage type maps to the same
exposure type under different
circumstances

Configuring the LOB model

i Line of Business model is implemented using typelists

* ClaimCenter manages the LOB model through a
series of six interconnected typelists

* Typecodes in each typelist reference typecodes in the
typelists above and below it

¢ For example, the “PersonalAuto" policy typecode
references one parent LOB code (“PersonalAutoLine")
and thirty-six child coverage typecodes (such as
“PACollisionCov* and “PAComprehensiveCov”)

A ===ii B A has 0 or more Bs

Typelists:

CoverageSubtype

ExposureType

Gi

Auto

PersonalAuto
Line

PersonalAuto

PACollisionCov

PACollisionCov

VehicleDamage

i LOB typelists have children and parents

Each element in an LOB typelist has a
Children node

¢ Displays its relationships with elements in
the next node down

« Exposure Type has no next node down, so
no Children node

Each element also has a Parents node

¢ Displays its relationships with elements in
the next node up

« Loss Type has no next node up, so no
Parents node

PolicyType.ttx

Gi

i “Other Categories” node G

* Some Line of Business typelists are associated with “other” typelists

* These may be “incoming” or “outgoing”

« For example, LOBCode, PolicyType, CoverageType, and CoverageSubtype are all associated
with the SourceSystem typelist

¢ These “other” typelists are also listed in the Incoming Categories and Outgoing
Categories tabs of the Line of Business typelists

Question

,— — Whatis ClaimCenter’s line of business (LOB) model?

7
¢

ee

Answer

_— — Whatis ClaimCenter’s line of business (LOB) model?

¢
¢
The correct answer is the hierarchy that organizes policies, coverages, and covered

losses.

Se see aS SSeS

¢
7
¢

ee

Answer

_— — Whatis the purpose of the Coverage Subtype in the LOB model?

¢

¢
¢ The correct answer is that it provides a M:M mapping between coverage types and
exposure types.

Se see aS SSeS

: policy administration system?

7

ee

Gi

Answer

Pa policy administration system?
¢

The correct answers are exposure type and coverage subtype.

a i “ typelist, outside of the LOB model, must every exposure type be

ee

a i “ typelist, outside of the LOB model, must every exposure type be
, ?

Question

,- — Why does Guidewire recommend to not delete typecodes from the Line
Pa of Business model?

ee

Gi

Answer

,- — Why does Guidewire recommend to not delete typecodes from the Line
Pa of Business model?

The correct answer is that it can result in inconsistencies which will cause the server
not to start.
